officialLinks.name: Air India – Travelling with Pets (policy hub)
Air India – Pets in Cabin Guidelines (PDF)

sourceDates.note: No 'last updated' date shown on page.
No 'last updated' date shown on page.
No publication date shown on document.
No publication date shown on document.

policyFindings: Only domesticated cats and dogs are accepted.
Weight categories: up to 10 kg (pet + carrier) allowed in cabin (Economy only); 10–32 kg as checked baggage/cargo; over 32 kg cargo only.
Pets in cabin are not allowed on Ultra Long Haul flights.
PETC booking at least 48 hours before departure; document verification required; report to airport 3 hours before departure.

In-cabin limits: one pet per passenger; each passenger may also check one pet as baggage; maximum two pets in the cabin per flight; if a service animal is present, the total cabin pet count (including the service animal) remains two.
In-cabin seating: Economy cabin only; last row aisle seats; two cabin pets must be seated at least five rows apart; no exit rows; the pet cannot occupy a seat.
In-cabin carrier: soft-sided kennel only, maximum 17 × 10 × 9 in (L×W×H); must be leak-proof, secure, ventilated on three sides, without wheels, and fit fully under the seat.

Checked baggage/cargo container: hard case required that complies with IATA Live Animals Regulations; pet + container must be ≤32 kg for checked baggage; >32 kg must go as cargo; crate must allow natural turning/standing/lying, be strong and leak-proof, ventilated on at least three sides (≥16% total side area), have secure fastenings and outside access for food/water, and have wheels removed/disabled.

Documents for domestic travel: pet passport/vaccination record, vet-signed health and rabies certificate issued within 7 days of departure; originals checked at the airport. For international travel: include all required entry permits/import licenses for destination/transit authorities. Minimum age: 8 weeks (cabin), 3 months (hold).
Indemnity form required: carry two copies for direct flights and four for connecting flights.

Passenger/behavior restrictions: unaccompanied minors may not travel with pets; passengers requiring wheelchair assistance or traveling with an infant may not carry pets in cabin (pet may travel in hold); muzzles/leashes required for dogs; no sedation/tranquilizers; no food inside the carrier; one pet per container; airline may refuse carriage for safety, non-compliance, aggression, pregnancy, sedation, or allergy concerns.

Breed/temperature restrictions: brachycephalic (snub-/flat-faced) breeds are not permitted in the cargo compartment due to respiratory/temperature risk; cabin travel may be possible but consult a veterinarian; the indemnity form warns of increased risk in higher temperatures.
Fees (per sector; taxes extra; non-refundable/non-transferable unless airline conditions prevent cabin travel).
In-cabin fees (≤10 kg including carrier): Domestic INR 7,500; Short-haul international USD 140; Medium-haul international (Europe excluding UK, Israel) USD 160.
Checked baggage fees (10–32 kg): Domestic INR 16,000; Short-haul international USD 350; Medium-haul international USD 350; International-to-International USD 350.

Route restrictions: currently unable to transport pets into or out of USA, Canada, Australia in cabin and/or as checked baggage; to/from UK, pets may travel only as cargo (LHR/LGW; not available at BHX); UAE: PETC allowed only on flights departing from UAE; PETC not permitted on flights departing India and arriving in UAE.
India import/export: AQCS NOC/Pre-import Clearance required; service available only via Bengaluru, Chennai, Delhi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Hyderabad.
Service animals: trained guide dogs assisting passengers with impaired vision/hearing are carried free of charge (must also meet destination country rules).
Emotional support animals are not accepted.
notes: Air India’s in-cabin size limit is explicitly 17 × 10 × 9 in soft-sided and must fit under-seat. Use this for cabin compliance.

The FAQ also lists a 'maximum permissible size … for carriage of pets in the cabin' of 46 × 46 × 30 cm (18 × 18 × 11 in) under a section discussing pets over 10 kg. Because pets over 10 kg cannot travel in the cabin, this appears contextually misplaced; prioritize the dedicated PETC guidance above when sizing an in-cabin carrier.
PDFs and pages do not show 'last updated' stamps; confirm details with Air India before purchase, especially for routes with restrictions (USA/Canada/Australia/UK/UAE/ULH).
The Pets in Cabin Guidelines PDF contains a '10 kg / 15 lbs' label in one spot but all current pages and tables consistently show 10 kg / 22 lb; rely on 10 kg / 22 lb.

finalDoc.PetPolicySummary: Air India accepts only domesticated cats and dogs. Book pet-in-cabin at least 48 hours before departure (arrive 3 hours early for check-in and document verification). In-cabin is limited to Economy only, max two pets per flight and one pet per passenger. Pet + soft carrier must be 10 kg (22 lb) or less and the carrier must fit fully under-seat; dogs must be muzzled and leashed in flight. Pets over 10 kg up to 32 kg (including crate) may travel as checked baggage in the hold; over 32 kg must go as cargo. Minimum age: 8 weeks (cabin) and 3 months (hold). Pregnant pets are not accepted. Brachycephalic (snub/flat-faced) breeds are not permitted in the cargo hold; cabin may be possible after consulting a vet. Indemnity form required (two copies for direct flights; four for connections). Domestic travel generally requires a recent health and rabies certificate signed by a veterinarian (typically within 7 days); international travel also requires all destination/transit permits and compliance with quarantine rules. Route restrictions apply: pets are not accepted to/from USA, Canada, Australia in cabin/checked baggage; to/from the UK pets may travel only as cargo; PETC is not permitted on India→UAE flights (allowed from UAE subject to rules). PETC is not available on Ultra Long Haul flights. Emotional support animals are not accepted; trained service dogs are carried free of charge (with additional U.S. provisions for psychiatric service dogs on U.S. routes).
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Air India Pet Policy (Cats & Dogs only)

  • Booking: Request PETC at least 48 hours before departure; arrive 3 hours prior for check-in and document verification. Connecting pets are allowed only on AI–AI itineraries.
  • In Cabin (Economy only): Max 2 pets per flight; 1 pet per passenger. Pet + soft carrier ≤10 kg (22 lb). Carrier must be soft-sided, leak-proof, ventilated, and fit fully under the seat (max 17 × 10 × 9 in). Dogs must be muzzled and leashed onboard. No PETC on Ultra Long Haul flights.
  • Checked Baggage/Hold: Pet + hard crate >10 kg up to 32 kg. >32 kg must travel as cargo. IATA-compliant hard crate required.
  • Age & Health: Minimum age 8 weeks (cabin), 3 months (hold). Pregnant pets not accepted. No sedation or food inside the carrier.
  • Documents: Indemnity form required (2 copies direct; 4 for connections). Domestic: recent vet health certificate and rabies certificate (typically within 7 days). International: all destination/transit permits and quarantine compliance.
  • Breed/Temperature: Brachycephalic (snub-/flat-faced) breeds are not permitted in the cargo hold; cabin may be possible but consult a veterinarian.
  • Seating: Last rows in Economy; no exit rows; two PETC must be seated ≥5 rows apart; pet cannot occupy a seat or be carried on lap.
  • Route Restrictions: Not accepted to/from USA, Canada, Australia in cabin/checked baggage. To/from UK: cargo only (LHR/LGW; not BHX). UAE: PETC not permitted India→UAE; allowed ex-UAE subject to rules.
  • Fees (per sector; taxes extra; non-refundable unless airline operationally disallows PETC): In-cabin (≤10 kg): Domestic INR 7,500; Short-haul international USD 140; Medium-haul international USD 160. Checked baggage (10–32 kg): Domestic INR 16,000; Short-/Medium-haul/Int’l-to-Int’l USD 350.
  • Service Animals: Trained service dogs travel free (destination rules apply). Emotional support animals are not accepted. On U.S. routes, psychiatric service dogs are accepted subject to U.S. requirements.
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails: Economy cabin only. Book at least 48 hours pre-departure; check in 3 hours early. Limits: max two pets per flight; one pet per passenger. Pet + carrier must be ≤10 kg (22 lb). Carrier must be soft-sided, leak-proof, ventilated on multiple sides, without wheels, and fit fully under the seat (max 17 × 10 × 9 in). Seating in last rows of Economy; two PETC seated at least five rows apart; no exit rows; pet cannot occupy a seat or be carried on lap. Dogs must be muzzled and leashed in flight. No food inside carrier; do not sedate. Minimum age 8 weeks. Not available on Ultra Long Haul flights. Route limits: PETC not accepted on India→UAE sectors; restrictions apply for USA/Canada/Australia (not accepted as cabin/checked baggage). Indemnity form required.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails: Checked baggage/hold: pet + IATA-compliant hard crate >10 kg up to 32 kg; over 32 kg must ship as cargo. Minimum age 3 months for hold. Brachycephalic breeds are not permitted in the cargo hold. Crate must be hard-sided, secure, leak-proof, ventilated on at least three sides, allow natural standing/turning/lying, have food/water access from outside, and wheels removed/disabled. Documents: valid vaccination records, recent health and rabies certificates (typically within 7 days domestic), and all required permits for international travel. Route restrictions: pets not accepted as cabin/checked baggage to/from USA, Canada, Australia; to/from UK pets travel cargo only (LHR/LGW; not BHX).
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails:
In-Cabin Carrier & Travel Details

  • Eligibility: Domesticated cats and dogs only; Economy cabin; not available on Ultra Long Haul flights.
  • Booking: Request PETC at least 48 hours before departure; report 3 hours before flight for checks. Only AI–AI connections allowed for itineraries with pets.
  • Quantity: Max 2 pets per flight cabin; 1 pet per passenger. If a service animal is present, total animals in cabin still capped at 2.
  • Weight: Pet + carrier must be ≤10 kg (22 lb).
  • Carrier: Soft-sided only; max 17 × 10 × 9 in (L×W×H). Must be leak-proof, secure, without wheels, and fit fully under the seat; ventilated on at least three sides.
  • Seating: Last row(s) of Economy; PETC passengers seated at least 5 rows apart; no exit rows; pet cannot occupy a seat or be carried on lap.
  • Pet care: Dogs must be muzzled and leashed onboard. No sedation/tranquilizers. No food items inside the carrier. One pet per carrier. Place absorbent lining; label carrier with pet’s name.
  • Age & Health: Min 8 weeks (cabin). Pregnant pets not accepted.
  • Documents: Indemnity form (2 copies direct; 4 for connections), vaccination record, recent health and rabies certificates (typically within 7 days for domestic). International trips require destination/transit permits and may involve quarantine.
  • Fees (per sector; taxes extra): Domestic INR 7,500; Short-haul international USD 140; Medium-haul international USD 160. Non-refundable/non-transferable unless PETC is denied by airline for operational reasons.
  • Route restrictions: PETC not accepted on India→UAE sectors; pets not accepted as cabin/checked baggage to/from USA, Canada, Australia; to/from UK: cargo only.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails:
Checked Baggage & Cargo (Hold)

  • Weight categories: >10 kg up to 32 kg (pet + crate) may travel as checked baggage; >32 kg must travel as cargo.
  • Crate: IATA-compliant hard case required; pet must be able to stand, turn, and lie naturally; crate must be secure, leak-proof, and ventilated on multiple sides; wheels removed/disabled; food/water access from outside.
  • Age & Health: Minimum 3 months for hold. Pregnant pets not accepted. No sedation.
  • Breed restriction: Brachycephalic (snub-/flat-faced) breeds are not permitted in the cargo hold due to elevated risk.
  • Documents: Vaccination record plus recent vet health and rabies certificates (typically within 7 days for domestic). International shipments require all destination/transit permits and may be subject to quarantine.
  • Route restrictions: Pets are not accepted as cabin/checked baggage to/from USA, Canada, Australia. To/from UK, pet travel is allowed only as cargo via LHR/LGW (not BHX). Additional operational or aircraft-type limits may apply.
  • Cut-off: Present pets for cargo/check-in with confirmed booking; arrive early (recommend 3–4 hours) to complete formalities.

Fees (per sector; taxes extra): Checked baggage 10–32 kg — Domestic INR 16,000; Short-/Medium-haul/International-to-International USD 350.
finalDoc.brachycephalicBreedList: Dogs: American Pit Bull,  American Staffordshire Terrier,  Boston Terrier,  Boxer, Brussels Griffon,  Mastiff (All Breeds),  Bulldog,  Bull Terrier,  Chow Chow,  Dutch Pug,  English Bulldog,  English Toy Spaniel,  French Bulldog,  Japanese Boxer,  Japanese Pug,  Japanese Spaniel,  Pekingese,  Pug,  Shih Tzu,  Staffordshire Bull Terrier Cats: Burmese,  Exotic Shorthair,  Himalayan,  Persian
finalDoc.serviceAnimalDetails:
Service Animals

Air India accepts trained service dogs free of charge in the cabin, subject to destination-specific regulations and documentation.

Requirements

  • Must be a dog individually trained to perform tasks for a qualified person with a disability (including physical, sensory, psychiatric, intellectual, or other mental disabilities).
  • Must be harnessed, leashed, or tethered and under control at all times.
  • All required health/vaccination certificates and entry permits for destination/transit countries must be presented.

Route-specific notes

  • United States routes: Air India accepts service dogs, including psychiatric service dogs, in accordance with applicable U.S. requirements.
  • Emotional Support Animals (ESAs) are not accepted.
  • Cabin animal limits: if a service dog is present, the total number of animals allowed in cabin on that flight remains capped at two.
